description: Lenart Kova, consulting private analysis and underground contacts, quietly decides to trigger Directive Zero, the secret failsafe left by Marek Halden. The decision is irreversible and will suspend all BCI activity pending a public vote.

Sudden citywide notifications announce that BCI enforcement and monitoring are frozen under 'Directive Zero.' Citizens are told that an open vote will soon decide the fate of automated governance in Stenograd.
Council factions and BCI administrators realize they are locked out of the system. Emergency sessions are held in vain as technical teams confirm that the failsafe cannot be bypassed.

Anonymous broadcasts invite all citizens to debate and participate in a binding vote: restore the BCI, call for reform, or dismantle automated governance altogether. The city becomes alive with public forums and open discussion.

Voting concludes. The majority chooses partial restoration of the BCI, but with unprecedented demands for transparency and external oversight. The discredited Council is forced to accept the will of the people and operate under new limitations.
